text: decisions made by the sector estate or
media mergers under the Enterprise Act
2002 are made on a quasi-judicial basis
I want to be very clear about what that
means when taking a quasi-judicial
decision I am tightly bound I must take
my decision only on the basis of the
evidence that is relevant to the
specified public interests my decision
cannot be based on opinion speculation
or conjecture any decision I take must
be objectively justified that I by the
facts before me
I'm assessed side wider political
considerations going beyond the scope of
the legislation I must act independently
and follow a process that is
scrupulously fair and impartial and this
is what I am doing on the question of
whether the merger gives rise to public
interest concerns in relation to media
plurality off cons report is unambiguous
it concludes the transaction raises
public interest concerns as a result of
the risk of increased influence by
members of the Murdoch family trust over
the UK news agenda and the political
process with its unique presence on
radio television in print and online we
consider that these concerns may justify
reference by the effective state to the
competition and Markets Authority on the
basis of Ofcom's assessment I confirm
that I am minded to refer to a phase 2
investigation on the grounds of media
plurality the reasoning and evidence
from which Ofcom's recommendation is
based on persuasive the proposed entity
would have the third-largest total reach
of any news provider lower only than the
BBC and ITN and would uniquely span news
coverage on television radio in
newspapers and online Ofcom's report
states that the proposed transaction
would give the murdoch family trust
material influence over news providers
with a significant presence across all
key platforms there's potentially raises
public interest concerns because in off
comms view the transaction may increase
members of the murdoch family trust
ability to influence the overall news
agenda and their ability to influence
the political process and it may also
result in the perception of increased
influence
these are clear grounds whereby referral
to a Phase two investigation is
warranted so that is what I am minded to
do there is however a statutory process
that I must follow I am required by
legislation to allow the parties the
opportunity to make representations to
me on this position before I reach a
final decision I will now do that and
have given them until Friday the 14th of
July to respond
the second question concerns whether
after the merger the relevant media
enterprises would have a genuine
commitment to broadcasting standards
Ofcom
is unequivocal it concludes in light of
foxes and skies broadcast compliance
records and taking accounts of our
separate assessment of whether sky
remains fit and proper to hold
broadcasting licenses following the
transaction we do not consider that the
merged entity would lack a genuine
commitment to the attainment of
broadcasting standards therefore we
consider that there are no broadcasting
standards concerns that may justify
reference by the Secretary of State to
the competition and Markets Authority
Ofcom's approach sought to measure
commitment to broadcasting standards by
reference to breaches of regulatory
codes
it found that Fox's compliance with the
UK's broadcasting code is in line with
comparable broadcasters nor did Fox's
compliance record in relation to
overseas broadcast jurisdictions where
Ofcom's analysis focused largely on the
EU did cause for concern I also ourself
come to consider the effect of any
failure of corporate governance on this
public interest consideration of Kon did
this in the context of its separate
assessment of whether Fox and sky would
remain fit and proper to hold broadcast
licenses following the transaction it
concluded that behaviors alleged at Fox
News in the u.s. amount significant
corporate failures however these did not
in its view demonstrate that the merged
company would lack a genuine commitment
to broadcasting standards
in reaching of you I have to be guided
only by the evidence before me as such
based on the Ofcom report I am currently
minded not to refer to a Phase two
investigation in relation to a genuine
commitment to broadcasting standards as
required by legislation I am giving the
parties an opportunity to make
representations in relation to media
plurality grounds where I am minded to
refer for a Phase two investigation both
CLA in the interest of transparency and
ensuring all the evidence has been
considered I will also invite wider
representations on the question of
commitment to broadcasting standards
where I am currently minded not to refer
for Phase two investigation parties
responding to consultations should not
simply duplicate any representations
previously made to Ofcom instead
responses should be limited to setting
out any new and substantial evidence and
any comment on Ofcom's
overall approach while there are strong
feelings among both supporters and
opponents of this merger in this quasi
judicial process my decisions can only
be influenced by the fact not opinions
and by the quality of evidence not who
shouts the loudest the invitation to
make representations will open today and
close on Friday the 14th of July and can
be found on the DCMS website under the
process set out an Enterprise Act it is
open to the parties to propose
undertakings in lieu of a reference to
the CMA for a more detailed
investigation in other words the parties
may seek to avoid a phase 2 reference by
proposing remedies to address the public
interest concerns that have been
provisionally been identified the
decision as to whether or not to accept
undertaking in lieu
is for the secretary of state alone
however and somewhat unusually the
parties proposed a second undertakings
to Ofcom and often commented on them in
its report proposed undertakings
centered around Fox maintaining the
editorial independence of Sky News by
establishing a separate editorial board
with the majority of independent members
to oversee the appointment at the head
of Sky News and any changes to Sky News
editorial guidelines they also include a
commitment to maintain Sky branded news
to five years with spending at least a
similar levels to now
Ofcom's view was that these remedies
would mitigate the serious media
plurality public interest concerns they
also suggested that the remedies could
be further strengthened the parties last
week without prejudice to my decision
today which they only learned of this
morning formally submitted undertakings
in larger the same terms to me in
accordance with the legislation if I
still intend to refer the merger after
having considered representations from
the party I am required to consider
whether or not these remedies are
appropriate given the parties have
offered these undertakings and Ofcom
have commented on them I have taken an
initial view and I can confirm that I
have today written to the parties
indicated that I am minded not to accept
the undertakings that has been offered
while Ofcom suggests that they may
mitigate its concerns it is for the
secretary of state to decide whether
they sufficiently mitigate or ideally
fully remedy what our serious public
interest considerations I note the toff
cons report says we recognize that
behavioral undertakings can be difficult
to monitor and enforced and that there
are areas in which the proposed
undertakings could be strengthened it
cites questions regarding the ongoing
arrangements for the appointment of the
independent members of this Guyanese
editorial board and the period of Fox's
commitment to maintaining its
investments in Sky News I also note the
guidance of the competition and Markets
Authority which in the context of
competition cases say that UI elzar
appropriate where the remedies are
clear-cut effective and capable of ready
implementation and that in ordinary
cases it is highly unlikely to accept
behavioural remedies at phase one I had
given the parties 10 working days until
Friday the 14th of July to make
representations on the minded to
decisions I've reached if I receive
further offers of undertakings as part
of those representations I will keep the
house informed on how I intend to
structure the statutory process I must
follow when considering them as I have
set out I will now take representations
on my minded two positions the call will
remain open for 10 working days and I
will then consider the evidence received
before coming to a final decision on
both grounds to be clear the minded two
decisions I've outlined today
or not my final decisions a word before
I close on/off can fit and proper
assessment as the independent regulator
this is a matter for Ofcom and my
understanding is that they will publish
their report today I have seen the
report and know many members in this
house will want to comment on it
however given my current cause our
judicial role in the merger I will not
be commenting on its findings it is
rightly not the government to determine
who should and should not hold TV
broadcasting licences Ofcom have an
ongoing duty to ensure all UK
broadcasters are fit and proper to hold
TV broadcasting licenses I am clear that
if any evidence comes to light than it
is for Ofcom to take account of evidence
I trust as before that this update is
helpful to honorable and right
honourable members and that this
statement gives an opportunity to debate
this important issue while at the same
time respecting the limits of what I can
say given my ongoing to cause our
judicial role in relation to this merger
and I commend this statement for house
